descript.abstract:
BaseAnno1200 contains textual descriptive information about real estate plats. This data set was originally created in 1986 from hand drawn 1:2400 half and 1:1200 quarter section maps. In 1995, this data was converted to an ArcInfo annotation class and held in the ArcStorm data base. The annotation data layer was converted in 2005 to an ESRI ArcGIS GeoDatabase.
Within the ArcInfo annotation class there were three subclasses. The "parcel" subclass contains information about parcels that was gathered from plats, Registered Land Surveys (RLSs) and other recorded documents; it contains text items such as lot and block numbers, plat names and parcel identifiers. The "road" subclass contains public road names, generally classified as Federal, State, County or Municipal road names. The "water" subclass contains text items for lakes, rivers and creeks.
With the conversion to an ArcGIS GeoDatabase, the "parcel" subclass was further divided. BaseAnno1200 includes lot and block numbers, plat names as well as Common Interest Community names & numbers.
descript.purpose:
The annotation data set is primarily utilized for map creation.
Text features contained within this data set add value to visual presentations making underlying data easier to interpret and understand. Features held in this database are utilized in the automated creation of half and quarter section maps.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.0.3348

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eaover: Attributes are related to the creation and digital conversion of parcel regions.
